node.title: 'I'd like to have access before I'm dead': Canberra man turned away from local post office
node.alt: A man sits in an electric wheelchair on the front lawn of a house with trees behind him
node.description: A Canberra man has been turned away from a local post office because it did not have wheelchair access, prompting an mea culpa from Australia Post and a promise for change.
node.content:
["Australia Post has apologised to a Canberra man who was turned away from his local branch\u00a0and told to go to another post office because it did not have wheelchair access.\u00a0", "JR Mitchell, who has multiple sclerosis and cancer, said he was embarrassed and felt discriminated against when he tried to use his local Australia Post office in Hawker, in Canberra's north.", "The store does not have wheelchair access, and when Mr Mitchell\u00a0raised the issue with Australia Post, he was told to travel to another store with disability access.", "Australia Post has since apologised to Mr Mitchell, and has vowed to audit all of its ACT branches to identify which ones lack wheelchair access.\u00a0", "", "
The Australia Post Office in Hawker in Canberra's north which does not have wheelchair access.(ABC News: Mark Moore)
", "
'I'd like to have access before I'm dead'
", "Mr Mitchell, who lives in Page, said the situation he faced outside the post office can cause people with disabilities to withdraw from society.\u00a0", "\"I put it to you, would you sit in my chair outside the post office, waving your arms around trying to attract the staff's attention?\" Mr Mitchell said.", "\"Then give your credit card to a complete stranger to go in and conduct your affairs for you because you can't go in there?", "Mr Mitchell complained to Australia Post's customer service team, who told him that the closest wheelchair accessible branch was Belconnen Post Office, at Westfield.\u00a0", "Mr Mitchell said travelling to Belconnen would mean he would have to pay for a wheelchair taxi, which he said was unfair given he had a local branch.\u00a0", "\"To be told to travel three times the distance to another post office because my local one doesn't have wheelchair access, well, I don't think that's acceptable \u2014 not in this day and age,\" he said.", "He believes a portable ramp would be a quick and cost-effective fix.", "", "
Disability advocates say people should not be forced to 'beg' to be noticed because a store does not have wheelchair access.\u00a0(Shutterstock: Nana_studio)
", "
Australia Post undertake accessibility review
", "A spokesperson for Australia Post said it was \"urgently working with the licensee and the landlord for a solution\" at Hawker Post Office, and have arranged for a builder to access the site.\u00a0", "\"Australia Post works towards providing dignified access for all of our customers, and we understand that with some of our older post offices this can be difficult, where building heritage issues may also need to be considered,\" the spokesperson said.", "\"Despite the challenges posed by limitations on travel over the past 18 months, Australia Post has recently undertaken an extensive accessibility review of our sites around the country, upgrading a number of premises including retrofitting ramps and automatic doors, and further enhancements are planned as part of a major works program.\"", "Australia Post said it would audit all of its ACT stores to ensure they had wheelchair access.\u00a0", "Disability advocate Dougie Herd, who also relies\u00a0on a wheelchair, said he was disappointed Australia Post was only addressing the problem now.", "\"It's simply unacceptable, unreasonable and unfair that anyone should have to sit or stand outside an inaccessible property of any type that's providing a service and beg to be noticed, beg to be able to get in,\" Mr Herd said.\u00a0", "\"Australia Post is a public service, owned by the people of Australia, and it should be fully inclusive and fully accessible to all Australians.\"", "Mr Herd said that Australia Post audit \"should be conducted by people who know how to conduct an inclusion and access audit and that usually means involving people with disability\"."]
